    34â†’class ProtocolError(Exception):
    35â†’    pass

    37â†’class MessageParser:
    38â†’    @staticmethod
    39â†’    def pack_u32(value: int) -> bytes:
    40â†’        return struct.pack('>I', value)
    41â†’    
    42â†’    @staticmethod
    43â†’    def unpack_u32(data: bytes, offset: int = 0) -> Tuple[int, int]:
    44â†’        if len(data) < offset + 4:
    45â†’            raise ProtocolError("Insufficient data for u32")
    46â†’        value = struct.unpack('>I', data[offset:offset+4])[0]
    47â†’        return value, offset + 4
    48â†’    
    49â†’    @staticmethod
    50â†’    def pack_str(value: str) -> bytes:
    51â†’        encoded = value.encode('ascii')
    52â†’        return MessageParser.pack_u32(len(encoded)) + encoded
    53â†’    
    54â†’    @staticmethod
    55â†’    def unpack_str(data: bytes, offset: int = 0) -> Tuple[str, int]:
    56â†’        length, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(data, offset)
    57â†’        if len(data) < offset + length:
    58â†’            raise ProtocolError("Insufficient data for string")
    59â†’        value = data[offset:offset+length].decode('ascii')
    60â†’        return value, offset + length
    61â†’    
    62â†’    @staticmethod
    63â†’    def calculate_checksum(data: bytes) -> int:
    64â†’        return (256 - (sum(data) % 256)) % 256
    65â†’    
    66â†’    @staticmethod
    67â†’    def pack_message(msg_type: int, content: bytes) -> bytes:
    68â†’        length = 1 + 4 + len(content) + 1  # type + length + content + checksum
    69â†’        header = struct.pack('>BI', msg_type, length) + content
    70â†’        checksum = MessageParser.calculate_checksum(header)
    71â†’        return header + struct.pack('>B', checksum)
    72â†’    
    73â†’    @staticmethod
    74â†’    def verify_checksum(data: bytes) -> bool:
    75â†’        return sum(data) % 256 == 0
    76â†’

    93â†’    async def handle_client(self, reader: asyncio.StreamReader, writer: asyncio.StreamWriter):
    94â†’        try:
    95â†’            
    96â†’            # First message from server to client must be Hello
    97â†’            await self.send_hello(writer)
    98â†’
    99â†’            # First message from client to server must be Hello
   100â†’            if not await self.handle_hello(reader, writer, is_client=True):
   101â†’                return
   102â†’            
   103â†’            while True:
   104â†’                msg_type, length, content = await self.read_message(reader)
   105â†’                if msg_type is None:
   106â†’                    break
   107â†’                    
   108â†’                if msg_type == 0x58:  # SiteVisit
   109â†’                    await self.handle_site_visit(content, writer)

   118â†’
   119â†’            try:

   128â†’    async def handle_hello(self, reader: asyncio.StreamReader, writer: asyncio.StreamWriter, is_client: bool = False) -> bool:
   129â†’        try:
   130â†’            msg_type, length, content = await self.read_message(reader)
   131â†’            if msg_type is None:
   132â†’                # Connection closed before getting a message
   133â†’                return False
   134â†’            
   135â†’            if msg_type != 0x50:
   136â†’                await self.send_error(writer, "first message must be Hello")
   137â†’                return False
   138â†’            
   139â†’            # Parse Hello message
   140â†’            offset = 0
   141â†’            protocol, offset = MessageParser.unpack_str(content, offset)
   142â†’            version, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(content, offset)
   143â†’            
   144â†’            if protocol != "pestcontrol" or version != 1:
   145â†’                await self.send_error(writer, "Invalid protocol or version")
   146â†’                return False
   147â†’
   148â†’            return True
   149â†’        except ProtocolError as e:
   150â†’            await self.send_error(writer, str(e))
   151â†’            return False
   152â†’        except Exception as e:
   153â†’            await self.send_error(writer, f"Protocol error: {e}")
   154â†’            return False
   155â†’    
   156â†’    async def send_hello(self, writer: asyncio.StreamWriter):
   157â†’        content = MessageParser.pack_str("pestcontrol") + MessageParser.pack_u32(1)
   158â†’        message = MessageParser.pack_message(0x50, content)
   159â†’        writer.write(message)
   160â†’        await writer.drain()
   161â†’    
   162â†’    async def send_error(self, writer: asyncio.StreamWriter, error_msg: str):
   163â†’        logger.debug(f"Sending error: {error_msg}")
   164â†’        try:
   165â†’            content = MessageParser.pack_str(error_msg)
   166â†’            message = MessageParser.pack_message(0x51, content)
   167â†’            writer.write(message)
   168â†’            await writer.drain()
   169â†’        except Exception as e:
   170â†’            logger.error(f"Error sending error message: {e}")

   172â†’    async def send_ok(self, writer: asyncio.StreamWriter):
   173â†’        message = MessageParser.pack_message(0x52, b'')
   174â†’        writer.write(message)
   175â†’        await writer.drain()

   177â†’    async def read_message(self, reader: asyncio.StreamReader) -> Tuple[Optional[int], Optional[int], Optional[bytes]]:
   178â†’        try:
   179â†’            # Read message type
   180â†’            type_data = await reader.readexactly(1)
   181â†’            msg_type = type_data[0]
   182â†’            
   183â†’            # Read length
   184â†’            length_data = await reader.readexactly(4)
   185â†’            length = struct.unpack('>I', length_data)[0]
   186â†’            
   187â†’            if length < 6 or length > 10000000:  # Reasonable bounds check - increased for long messages
   188â†’                raise ProtocolError(f"Invalid message length: {length}")
   189â†’            
   190â†’            # Read remaining content (length - 5 bytes for type and length field)
   191â†’            remaining = length - 5
   192â†’            content_and_checksum = await reader.readexactly(remaining)
   193â†’            
   194â†’            # Verify checksum
   195â†’            full_message = type_data + length_data + content_and_checksum
   196â†’            if not MessageParser.verify_checksum(full_message):
   197â†’                raise ProtocolError("Invalid checksum")
   198â†’            
   199â†’            content = content_and_checksum[:-1]  # Exclude checksum byte
   200â†’            return msg_type, length, content
   201â†’        except asyncio.IncompleteReadError:
   202â†’            return None, None, None
   203â†’    
   204â†’    async def handle_site_visit(self, content: bytes, client_writer: asyncio.StreamWriter):
   205â†’        offset = 0
   206â†’        site_id, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(content, offset)
   207â†’        
   208â†’        # Parse populations array
   209â†’        array_length, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(content, offset)
   210â†’        populations = []
   211â†’        species_seen = set()
   212â†’        
   213â†’        for i in range(array_length):
   214â†’            species, offset = MessageParser.unpack_str(content, offset)
   215â†’            count, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(content, offset)
   216â†’            
   217â†’            # Check for conflicting duplicates
   218â†’            if species in species_seen:
   219â†’                # Find existing entry
   220â†’                for pop in populations:
   221â†’                    if pop.species == species and pop.count != count:
   222â†’                        await self.send_error(client_writer, f"Conflicting counts for species {species}")
   223â†’                        return
   224â†’            
   225â†’            species_seen.add(species)
   226â†’            populations.append(ObservedPopulation(species, count))
   227â†’        
   228â†’        logger.info(f"Site visit for site {site_id}: {[(p.species, p.count) for p in populations]}")
   229â†’        
   230â†’        # Get or establish authority connection
   231â†’        try:
   232â†’            # Ensure we have a lock for this site
   233â†’            if site_id not in self.site_locks:
   234â†’                self.site_locks[site_id] = asyncio.Lock()
   235â†’            
   236â†’            # Use per-site lock to serialize authority communication
   237â†’            async with self.site_locks[site_id]:
   238â†’                await self.ensure_authority_connection(site_id)
   239â†’                await self.update_policies(site_id, populations)
   240â†’        except Exception as e:
   241â†’            logger.error(f"Error handling site visit: {e}")
   242â†’            import traceback
   243â†’            traceback.print_exc()
   244â†’            # Don't send error to client for site visits - spec says no response for valid messages
   245â†’    
   246â†’    async def ensure_authority_connection(self, site_id: int):
   247â†’        if site_id not in self.authority_connections:
   248â†’            # Connect to Authority Server
   249â†’            try:
   250â†’                reader, writer = await asyncio.open_connection('pestcontrol.protohackers.com', 20547)
   251â†’                
   252â†’                # Send Hello
   253â†’                await self.send_hello(writer)
   254â†’                
   255â†’                # Expect Hello response
   256â†’                if not await self.handle_hello(reader, writer, is_client=False):
   257â†’                    writer.close()
   258â†’                    await writer.wait_closed()
   259â†’                    raise ProtocolError("Failed to establish authority connection")
   260â†’                
   261â†’                # Send DialAuthority
   262â†’                content = MessageParser.pack_u32(site_id)
   263â†’                message = MessageParser.pack_message(0x53, content)
   264â†’                writer.write(message)
   265â†’                await writer.drain()
   266â†’                
   267â†’                # Read TargetPopulations response
   268â†’                msg_type, length, content = await self.read_message(reader)
   269â†’                if msg_type == 0x51:  # Error message
   270â†’                    error_msg, _ = MessageParser.unpack_str(content, 0)
   271â†’                    raise ProtocolError(f"Authority server error: {error_msg}")
   272â†’                elif msg_type != 0x54:
   273â†’                    raise ProtocolError(f"Expected TargetPopulations, got {msg_type:02x}")
   274â†’                
   275â†’                # Parse TargetPopulations
   276â†’                offset = 0
   277â†’                returned_site_id, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(content, offset)
   278â†’                if returned_site_id != site_id:
   279â†’                    raise ProtocolError(f"Site ID mismatch: expected {site_id}, got {returned_site_id}")
   280â†’                
   281â†’                array_length, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(content, offset)
   282â†’                targets = []
   283â†’                for i in range(array_length):
   284â†’                    species, offset = MessageParser.unpack_str(content, offset)
   285â†’                    min_count, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(content, offset)
   286â†’                    max_count, offset = MessageParser.unpack_u32(content, offset)
   287â†’                    targets.append(TargetPopulation(species, min_count, max_count))
   288â†’                
   289â†’                self.authority_connections[site_id] = (reader, writer)
   290â†’                self.site_targets[site_id] = targets
   291â†’                self.site_policies[site_id] = {}
   292â†’                
   293â†’                logger.debug(f"Connected to authority for site {site_id}, targets: {[(t.species, t.min_count, t.max_count) for t in targets]}")
   294â†’                
   295â†’            except Exception as e:
   296â†’                logger.error(f"Failed to connect to authority for site {site_id}: {e}")
   297â†’                raise
   298â†’    
   299â†’    async def update_policies(self, site_id: int, populations: List[ObservedPopulation]):
   300â†’        if site_id not in self.authority_connections:
   301â†’            return
   302â†’        
   303â†’        targets = self.site_targets[site_id]
   304â†’        current_policies = self.site_policies[site_id]
   305â†’        
   306â†’        # Build species -> count mapping from observations
   307â†’        observed_counts = {pop.species: pop.count for pop in populations}
   308â†’        
   309â†’        # Build species -> target mapping
   310â†’        target_map = {target.species: target for target in targets}
   311â†’        
   312â†’        new_policies = {}
   313â†’        
   314â†’        for target in targets:
   315â†’            species = target.species
   316â†’            observed_count = observed_counts.get(species, 0)  # 0 if not observed
   317â†’            
   318â†’            required_action = None
   319â†’            if observed_count < target.min_count:
   320â†’                required_action = 0xa0  # conserve
   321â†’            elif observed_count > target.max_count:
   322â†’                required_action = 0x90  # cull
   323â†’            # else: within range, no policy needed
   324â†’            
   325â†’            current_policy = current_policies.get(species)
   326â†’            
   327â†’            if required_action is None:
   328â†’                # No policy needed
   329â†’                if current_policy:
   330â†’                    # Delete existing policy
   331â†’                    await self.delete_policy(site_id, current_policy.policy_id)
   332â†’                    logger.debug(f"Deleted policy {current_policy.policy_id} for {species} (now within range)")
   333â†’            else:
   334â†’                # Policy needed
   335â†’                if current_policy and current_policy.action == required_action:
   336â†’                    # Keep existing policy
   337â†’                    new_policies[species] = current_policy
   338â†’                else:
   339â†’                    # Delete old policy if exists
   340â†’                    if current_policy:
   341â†’                        await self.delete_policy(site_id, current_policy.policy_id)
   342â†’                        logger.debug(f"Deleted old policy {current_policy.policy_id} for {species}")
   343â†’                    
   344â†’                    # Create new policy
   345â†’                    policy_id = await self.create_policy(site_id, species, required_action)
   346â†’                    new_policies[species] = Policy(policy_id, species, required_action)
   347â†’                    action_str = "cull" if required_action == 0x90 else "conserve"
   348â†’                    logger.debug(f"Created policy {policy_id} to {action_str} {species} (count: {observed_count})")
   349â†’        
   350â†’        self.site_policies[site_id] = new_policies
   351â†’    
   352â†’    async def create_policy(self, site_id: int, species: str, action: int) -> int:
   353â†’        if site_id not in self.authority_connections:
   354â†’            raise ProtocolError(f"No authority connection for site {site_id}")
   355â†’        
   356â†’        reader, writer = self.authority_connections[site_id]
   357â†’        
   358â†’        content = MessageParser.pack_str(species) + struct.pack('>B', action)
   359â†’        message = MessageParser.pack_message(0x55, content)
   360â†’        writer.write(message)
   361â†’        await writer.drain()
   362â†’        
   363â†’        # Read PolicyResult response
   364â†’        msg_type, length, response_content = await self.read_message(reader)
   365â†’        if msg_type != 0x57:
   366â†’            raise ProtocolError(f"Expected PolicyResult, got {msg_type:02x}")
   367â†’        
   368â†’        policy_id, _ = MessageParser.unpack_u32(response_content, 0)
   369â†’        return policy_id
   370â†’    
   371â†’    async def delete_policy(self, site_id: int, policy_id: int):
   372â†’        if site_id not in self.authority_connections:
   373â†’            raise ProtocolError(f"No authority connection for site {site_id}")
   374â†’        
   375â†’        reader, writer = self.authority_connections[site_id]
   376â†’        
   377â†’        content = MessageParser.pack_u32(policy_id)
   378â†’        message = MessageParser.pack_message(0x56, content)
   379â†’        writer.write(message)
   380â†’        await writer.drain()
   381â†’        
   382â†’        # Read OK response
   383â†’        msg_type, length, response_content = await self.read_message(reader)
   384â†’        if msg_type != 0x52:
   385â†’            raise ProtocolError(f"Expected OK, got {msg_type:02x}")
   386â†’
   387â†’async def main():
   388â†’    port = 8080
   389â†’    for arg in sys.argv[1:]:
   390â†’        if arg == '--debug':
   391â†’            continue

Changes Made:


    

  1. Connection ID Generation: Added a simple counter for client connections (client-1, client-2, etc.) and created unique IDs for authority connections (authority-site-{site_id})
    

    2. 

  2. Updated All Logging: Modified all logging statements throughout the server to include connection IDs in the format [conn_id]
    

    3. 

  3. Authority Connection Tracking: Updated the authority connections dictionary to store a 3-tuple (reader, writer, auth_conn_id) instead of just (reader, writer)
    

    4. 

  4. Method Signatures: Updated all relevant method signatures to accept and pass connection IDs:
    

      

    • handle_hello(), send_hello(), send_error(), send_ok()
      • 

    • read_message(), handle_site_visit(), update_policies()
      • 

    

    5. 

  5. Cross-Connection Logging: For policy operations, logs now show both client and authority connection IDs like [client-1|authority-site-123]
    

    6. 



Testing Results:


The test showed that connection IDs are working correctly:


    

  • Multiple concurrent connections get unique IDs (client-1, client-2, client-3)
    • 

  • All log entries are properly tagged with connection IDs
    • 

  • Connection lifecycle events are tracked (connection established, Hello exchange, connection closed)
    •
